info.title: Event Portal Open API
info.description:
REST API Concepts

Solace PubSub+ Event Portal provides REST APIs that you can use to manage your data in PubSub+ Cloud. 
The REST APIs allow you to model your event-driven architectures from your own client applications.

The following document describes the public REST APIs available for use in Event Portal 2.0. Objects created in this 
version will not be available in Event Portal 1.0. APIs that display (Beta) in their summary are provided as-is and 
are subject to change or removal. They may not be of the quality expected for generally available APIs and have no 
guaranteed forward compatibility with the generally available version of the API.

get.description: Use this API to list enums based on certain criteria.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of enums to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: The IDs of the enums.

parameters.name: applicationDomainId
parameters.description: The application domain ID of the enums.

parameters.name: applicationDomainIds
parameters.description: Match only enums in the given application domain ids.

parameters.name: names
parameters.description: The names of the enums.

parameters.name: shared
parameters.description: Match only with shared or unshared enums.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort based on the provided parameters.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter only supports custom attribute values containing characters in `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.
parameters.example:
searching by single custom attribute definition: `color==red`.
Searching by single custom attribute name: `color`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute definition: `color==red;security==high`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute name: `color;security`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute name `AND` custom attribute definition: `color;security==high`

200.description: Retrieve a list of enums and the accompanying metadata.

post.description: description

201.description: Created an enum. The newly saved enum object is returned in the response body.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a list of events that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of events to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the event to match on.

parameters.name: shared
parameters.description: Match only with shared or unshared events.

parameters.name: applicationDomainId
parameters.description: Match only events in the given application domain.

parameters.name: applicationDomainIds
parameters.description: Match only events in the given application domain ids.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter only supports custom attribute values containing characters in `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.
parameters.example:
searching by single custom attribute definition: `color==red`.
Searching by single custom attribute name: `color`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute definition: `color==red;security==high`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute name: `color;security`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute name `AND` custom attribute definition: `color;security==high`

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only events with the given IDs separated by commas.

200.description: Retrieve a list of applications and the accompanying metadata.

post.description: Events are the primary building block of an event-driven architecture. Applications publish and subscribe to events and events reference schemas.  In the Event Portal, an event is a type of event as opposed to a specific event instance.

requestBody.description: The event requires a name and an application domain ID.

201.description: Created an event. The newly saved event object is returned in the response body.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a list of Lifeycle States that match the given parameters.

200.description: Retrieve a list of lifecycle states and the accompanying metadata.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a list of schemas that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of schemas to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the schema to match on.

parameters.name: shared
parameters.description: Match only with shared or unshared schemas.

parameters.name: applicationDomainId
parameters.description: Match only schemas in the given application domain.

parameters.name: applicationDomainIds
parameters.description: Match only schemas in the given application domain ids.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only schemas with the given IDs separated by commas.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter only supports custom attribute values containing characters in `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.
parameters.example:
searching by single custom attribute definition: `color==red`.
Searching by single custom attribute name: `color`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute definition: `color==red;security==high`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute name: `color;security`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute name `AND` custom attribute definition: `color;security==high`

200.description: Retrieve a list of schemas and the accompanying metadata.

post.description: To model your event-driven architecture, schemas are a fundamental building block for modelling the payloads of the events flowing through your system. Use this API to create schemas that can later be referenced by events.

requestBody.description: The schema requires a name, an application domain, a schema type and a content type.

201.description: Created a schema. The newly saved schema object is returned in the response body.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of event APIs
get.description: Use this API to retrieve a list of event APIs that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of event APIs to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the event API to match on.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only event APIs with the given IDs separated by commas.

parameters.name: applicationDomainId
parameters.description: Match only event APIs in the given application domain.

parameters.name: applicationDomainIds
parameters.description: Match only event APIs in the given application domains.

parameters.name: eventApiVersionIds
parameters.description: Match only event APIs in the given event API version ids.

parameters.name: availableWithinApplicationDomainIds
parameters.description: Additionally match any shared event APIs in any application domain.

parameters.name: shared
parameters.description: Match only with shared or unshared event APIs.

parameters.name: brokerType
parameters.description: Match only event APIs with the given broker type.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The name of the field to sort on.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter only supports custom attribute values containing characters in `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.
parameters.example:
searching by single custom attribute definition: `color==red`.
Searching by single custom attribute name: `color`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute definition: `color==red;security==high`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute name: `color;security`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute name `AND` custom attribute definition: `color;security==high`

200.description: The list of event APIs and the accompanying metadata.

post.description: Use this API to create an event API.

201.description: Created an event API. The newly saved event API is returned in the response body.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a list of consumers that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of consumers to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: applicationVersionIds
parameters.description: Match only consumers with the given application version IDs, separated by commas.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only consumers with the given IDs separated by commas.

200.description: Retrieve a list of consumers and the accompanying metadata.

post.description: Use this API to create a consumer.

201.description: Created a consumer. Returns the newly saved consumer object in the response body.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a single enum by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the enum object.

200.description: The enum object.

delete.description: Use this API to delete an enum. The enum must not have any versions or else it cannot be deleted.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the enum.

204.description: No content is returned if the delete was successful.

404.description: If the enum did not exist.

patch.description: description

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the enum.

200.description: Updated an enum. The newly saved enum object is returned in the response body.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a list of event meshes that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of event meshes to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the event mesh to match on.

parameters.name: environmentId
parameters.description: Match only event meshes in the given environment

200.description: The list of event meshes and the accompanying metadata.

post.description: Creates an event mesh object.

201.description: Created an event mesh. The newly saved event object is returned in the response body.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a single event by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the event object.

200.description: The event object.

delete.description: Use this API to delete an event.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the event object.

patch.description: Use this API to update an event. You only need to specify the fields that need to be updated.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the event object to update.

200.description: The updated event object.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a list of topic domains that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of topic domains to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only topic domains with the given IDs separated by commas.

parameters.name: brokerType
parameters.description: Match only topic domains with the given brokerType.

parameters.name: applicationDomainIds
parameters.description: Match only topic domains with the given application domain ids separated by commas.

200.description: Retrieve a list of topic domains and the accompanying metadata.

post.description: Topic Domains govern the format of topic addresses within an application domain

201.description: Created a topic domain. Returns the newly saved topic domain object in the response body.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a list of enumeration versions that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of enumerations to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only enumeration versions with the given IDs separated by commas.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter only supports custom attribute values containing characters in `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.
parameters.example:
searching by single custom attribute definition: `color==red`.
Searching by single custom attribute name: `color`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute definition: `color==red;security==high`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute name: `color;security`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute name `AND` custom attribute definition: `color;security==high`

200.description: Retrieve a list of enumeration versions and the accompanying metadata.

post.description: description

requestBody.description: Enum object description with its values.

201.description: Created an enum version and its values. The newly saved enum version object is returned in the response body.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a list of applications that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of applications to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the application to match on.

parameters.name: applicationDomainId
parameters.description: Match only applications in the given application domain.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only applications with the given IDs separated by commas.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter only supports custom attribute values containing characters in `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.
parameters.example:
searching by single custom attribute definition: `color==red`.
Searching by single custom attribute name: `color`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute definition: `color==red;security==high`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute name: `color;security`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute name `AND` custom attribute definition: `color;security==high`

parameters.name: applicationType
parameters.description: Match only applications with the given applicationType.

200.description: Retrieve a list of applications and the accompanying metadata.

post.description: To model your event-driven architecture, applications are a fundamental building block for modelling the producers and consumers of events. Use this API to create applications and model the events they produce and consume.

requestBody.description: Applications have a name and live within an application domain. Events can be added to the application as produced or consumed.

201.description: Created an application. Returns the newly saved application object in the response body.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a single schema by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the schema object.

200.description: The schema object.

delete.description: Use this API to delete a schema. The schema must not be in use by any events else it cannot be deleted.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the schema object.

patch.description: Update a schema

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the schema object.

requestBody.description: The schema requires a name, an application domain, a schema type and a content type.

200.description: Updated a schema. The newly saved schema object is returned in the response body.

get.description: Use this API to list all environments.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of events to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

200.description: Retrieve a list of environments and the accompanying metadata.

parameters.name: customAttributes

To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.

parameters.name: ids

To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a single event API by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the event API.

200.description: The event API.

delete.description: Use this API to delete an event API.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the event API.

patch.description: Use this API to update an event API. You only need to specify the fields that need to be updated.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the event API to update.

200.description: The updated event API.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a single consumer by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the consumer object.

200.description: The consumer object.

delete.description: Use this API to delete a consumer.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the consumer

patch.description: Use this API to update a consumer.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the consumer

200.description: Updated a consumer. Returns the newly saved consumer object in the response body.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of event API versions
get.description: Use this API to retrieve a list of event API versions that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of results to return in one page of results.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get results from based on the page size.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match event API versions with the given IDs separated by commas.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: A list of additional entities to include in the response.
parameters.example: parent

parameters.name: stateId
parameters.description: Match event API versions with the given state ID.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter only supports custom attribute values containing characters in `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.
parameters.example:
searching by single custom attribute definition: `color==red`.
Searching by single custom attribute name: `color`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute definition: `color==red;security==high`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute name: `color;security`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute name `AND` custom attribute definition: `color;security==high`

200.description: Retrieve a list of event API versions.

post.description: Use this API to create an event API version.

201.description: Created an event API version. Returns the newly saved event API version in the response body.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of event API products
get.description: Use this API to retrieve a list of event API products that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of event API products to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: brokerType
parameters.description: Match only event API products with the given broken type.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the event API product to match on.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only event API products with the given IDs separated by commas.

parameters.name: applicationDomainId
parameters.description: Match only event API products in the given application domain.

parameters.name: applicationDomainIds
parameters.description: Match only event API products in the given application domains.

parameters.name: shared
parameters.description: Match only with shared or unshared event API products.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The name of the field to sort on.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter only supports custom attribute values containing characters in `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.
parameters.example:
searching by single custom attribute definition: `color==red`.
Searching by single custom attribute name: `color`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute definition: `color==red;security==high`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute name: `color;security`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute name `AND` custom attribute definition: `color;security==high`

200.description: The list of event API products and the accompanying metadata.

post.description: Use this API to create an event API product.

201.description: Created an event API product. The newly saved event API product is returned in the response body.

get.description: Retrieves a single event mesh by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the event mesh object.

200.description: The event mesh object.

delete.description: Use this API to delete an event mesh.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the event mesh object.

patch.description: Use this API to update an event mesh. You only need to specify the fields that need to be updated.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the event mesh object to update.

200.description: The updated event mesh object.

get.summary: (Beta) Retrieves a list of messaging services
get.description: Use this API to retrieve a list of messaging services that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of messaging services to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The name of the field to sort on.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: The IDs of the messaging services.

parameters.name: messagingServiceType
parameters.description: Match only messaging services of the given type

parameters.name: runtimeAgentId
parameters.description: Match only messaging services in the given runtimeAgentId

parameters.name: eventMeshId
parameters.description: Match only messaging services in the given eventMeshId

200.description: The list of messaging services and the accompanying metadata.

post.description: Use this API to create a messaging service object.

201.description: Created a messaging service. The newly saved object is returned in the response body.

delete.description: Use this API to delete an enum version. The version must not be in use by any events else it cannot be deleted. This also deletes the version's values.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the enum version object.

204.description: No content is returned if the delete was successful.

404.description: If the enum version did not exist.

patch.description: Use this API to update an enum version. You only need to specify the fields that need to be updated.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the enum version object to update.

200.description: The updated application version object.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a single application by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application object.

200.description: The application object.

delete.description: Use this API to delete an application.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application

patch.description: Use this API to update an application. You only need to specify the fields that need to be updated.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application object to update.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a single environment by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the environment object.

200.description: The environment object.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a list of application domains that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of application domains to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name to be used to match the application domain.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only application domains with the given IDs separated by commas.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Specify extra data to be included, options are: stats

200.description: Retrieve a list of application domains and the accompanying metadata.

post.description: To help keep your event-driven architecture organized, use application domains to create namespaces for your applications, events and schemas.

requestBody.description: Application domains have a name and topic domain.

201.description: Created. The newly saved application domain object is returned in the response body.

get.description: Use this API to retrieve a list of EMAs that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of EMAs to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The name of the field to sort on.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: The IDs of the EMAs.

parameters.name: createdBy
parameters.description: Match only EMAs created by this user

delete.description: Use this API to delete a messaging service.

parameters.description: The ID of the messaging service object.

patch.description: Use this API to update a messaging service. You only need to specify the fields that need to be updated. However, if you want to update anything under subObjects (i.e. anything inside messagingServiceConnections object), you need to provide the original messagingServiceConnections with the updated fields instead of just providing the changed fields.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the messaging service object to update.

200.description: The updated messaging service object.

get.summary: (Beta) Retrieves a list of event API product versions
get.description: Use this API to retrieve a list of event API product versions that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of results to return in one page of results.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get results from based on the page size.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match event API product versions with the given IDs separated by commas.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: A list of additional entities to include in the response.
parameters.example: parent

parameters.name: stateId
parameters.description: Match event API product versions with the given state ID.

parameters.name: messagingServiceId
parameters.description: Match event API product versions with the given messagingServiceId.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter only supports custom attribute values containing characters in `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.
parameters.example:
searching by single custom attribute definition: `color==red`.
Searching by single custom attribute name: `color`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute definition: `color==red;security==high`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute name: `color;security`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute name `AND` custom attribute definition: `color;security==high`

200.description: Retrieve a list of event API product versions.

post.summary: (Beta) Creates an event API product version
post.description: Use this API to create an event API product version.

201.description: Created an event API product version. Returns the newly saved event API product version in the response body.

The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter only supports custom attribute values containing characters in `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.
parameters.example:
searching by single custom attribute definition: `color==red`.
Searching by single custom attribute name: `color`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute definition: `color==red;security==high`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute name: `color;security`.
Searching by multiple custom attribute name `AND` custom attribute definition: `color;security==high`

get.summary: (Beta) Retrieves a list of messaging service scan data
get.description: Use this API to retrieve a list of messaging service scan data that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: scanId
parameters.description: The ID of the messaging service scan we want data for.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of messaging service scan data to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The name of the field to sort on.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: The IDs of the messaging service scan data.

parameters.name: collectionTypes
parameters.description: Match only scan data whose dataCollectionType matches the given list.

200.description: The list of messaging service scan data and the accompanying metadata.

get.summary: (Beta) Retrieves the raw configs in file format for an EMA object

parameters.description: The ID of the EMA object.

200.description: The EMA config in a yaml file named application.yml.
